comments:
The following appeared in the Eclipse error log after prolonged use.

Error
Tue Jun 13 14:35:28 EDT 2006
Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-in: "org.eclipse.core.resources".

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.jet.internal.SavedStateManager.getLogicalStatePath(SavedStateManager.java:177)
	at org.eclipse.jet.internal.SavedStateManager.doSave(SavedStateManager.java:146)
	at org.eclipse.jet.internal.SavedStateManager.saving(SavedStateManager.java:128)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.SaveManager.executeLifecycle(SaveManager.java:322)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.SaveManager$1.run(SaveManager.java:151)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:37)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.SaveManager.broadcastLifecycle(SaveManager.java:154)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.SaveManager.save(SaveManager.java:955)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.DelayedSnapshotJob.run(DelayedSnapshotJob.java:44)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

Created an attachment (id=44394)
Proposed Patch

About the patch: A WeakReference was being used, but code was not checking the result of WeakReference.get() for null.

Fred:

This error shows up in the Eclipse Error Log after a JET project has been deleted, and will show up periodically until the workbench is restarted. However, there is no loss of functionality. 

The fix is simple. Does this merit going into 1.0 ? Or can it wait til 1.0.1?

I dislike seeing messages in the error log that the user cannot act on, so my inclination is to fix it now.
